text:

(Martin makes a small sigh) 

The Magnus Archives – MAG 174 – The Great Beast 
8 
MARTIN 
(Irritated) Is it much further? 
(The Archivist makes an amused exhale) 
ARCHIVIST 
(Amused) Yes. 
(Martin sighs dramatically) 
I'm not entirely sure what you were expecting; it's the Vast. The clue is in the 
name. 
MARTIN 
Yes, alright. 
ARCHIVIST 
Just be glad that this is one of the domains that actually has ground to walk on. 
MARTIN 
Whatever. 
(Beat) 
[A thunderous earth-quaking boom from some distance away] 
MARTIN (CONT'D) 
S-so how far are we from the other side? And-and don't say time and space 
don't work here; that's a cop-out and you know it. 
(The Archivist sighs) 

The Magnus Archives – MAG 174 – The Great Beast 
9 
ARCHIVIST 
Fine. (smug) Three days. 
MARTIN 
(Immediate) Thank you! 
(Beat) 
MARTIN 
Wait. Wait, what counts as a day? 
ARCHIVIST 
(Amused) What an excellent question. 
MARTIN 
(Under breath) Oh my god— (normal) You can be infuriating sometimes, you 
know that? 
ARCHIVIST 
Yes. 
MARTIN 
Fine! Fine. How ‘bout Simon, how close are we to him? 
ARCHIVIST 
[Hissing static starts] 
Um... Close, but he's able to move a lot faster than we are in this place. 
[Hissing static ends] 

The Magnus Archives – MAG 174 – The Great Beast 
10 
MARTIN 
Meaning...? 
ARCHIVIST 
Meaning I know where he is, but, if he doesn't want us to reach him, I don't 
know if we'll have much of a chance. 
MARTIN 
So, so what, we're just going to trust him to (slight laugh) show up to his own 
execution— 
[Martin is cut off by a fast whooshing sound followed by the sound 
of brick and rock destruction; this is Simon Fairchild landing at 
speed in front of them, somewhat explosively] 
(Martin and the Archivist give a short yell of surprise) 
MARTIN 
Jesus! 
(A short laugh) 
ARCHIVIST 
(Surprised) Uh... apparently! 
SIMON FAIRCHILD 
Hello! 
(Simon makes a pained sound) 
[The sound of rubble as Simon pulls himself up out of the ground] 

The Magnus Archives – MAG 174 – The Great Beast 
11 
SIMON (CONT'D) 
Hello, dreadfully sorry! 
(Simon makes another pained sound) 
I only just noticed you were both here! That's the problem with having such a 
big place, you know, you can miss things if you're not careful. 
ARCHIVIST 
Uh-h. Right. 
(Martin makes a small shocked noise) 
SIMON 
Good to see you again, Martin! And you must be the famous Archivist. Herald 
of the Ceaseless Watcher, Harbinger of the New Age, etcetera. Lovely to meet 
you at last. 
(Small exhale from Archivist) 
Simon Fairchild, at your service. 
ARCHIVIST 
I know who you are. 
SIMON 
(Laughing) Of course you do. I imagine you know pretty much everything by 
this point. How is it? How does it feel? 
ARCHIVIST 
Strange. 

The Magnus Archives – MAG 174 – The Great Beast 
12 
SIMON 
Yes. I can imagine! These gifts can feel very disconcerting at times. I'm sure 
you'll get used to it eventually. 
And how are you, Martin? Still trying to save the world and all that? 
MARTIN 
Yes. 
SIMON 
Pity. Well, armageddon... (considering) it's not for everyone, I suppose. I'm 
quite enjoying it, of course, although Junior over there can be a little bit of a 
handful. 
[A thunderous earth-quaking boom from “Junior”, who is still some 
distance away] 
MARTIN 
(Disgusted) I might have guessed you'd be happy living in this nightmare. 
SIMON 
I mean, not that it matters, but, yes I am! Honestly, I think you could be too, if 
you set your mind to it. But I'm not one to tell you how to live your eternity. 
MARTIN 
No. You're not. Because I'm done listening to you! 
SIMON 
I'm sorry? I'm not sure I follow. 

The Magnus Archives – MAG 174 – The Great Beast 
13 
MARTIN 
All those lies you told me — you helped to do this, you turned the world into 
your, your playground. 
SIMON 
Um, not to be a pedant, but if you recall, I was actually doing a favour for 
Peter. And if Peter had won, none of this would have happened. Also, not to 
make excuses, but they weren't exactly lies. Just… oversimplifications of 
complicated truths. And guesses. 
A lot of guesses. 
Almost all guesses, really, now I come to think about it. 
MARTIN 
Shut up! I don't care. 
SIMON 
Goodness! We're rather tetchy, aren't we? 
ARCHIVIST 
We've... (slight laugh) not been having an easy journey. 
MARTIN 
John. 
ARCHIVIST 
What, it's true; we haven't.
